snippet: Americans enjoy less economic mobility than their peers in Canada and much of Western Europe in part because of the depth of poverty, family background and the gaps between the rich and the rest.
abstract: Many researchers say Americans enjoy less economic mobility than their peers in Canada and much of Western Europe in part because of poverty, family background and gaps between the rich and the rest; mobility gap has been widely discussed in academic circles, but a sour season of mass employment and street protests has moved the discussion toward center stage.
lead_paragraph: Americans enjoy less economic mobility than their peers in Canada and much of Western Europe in part because of the depth of poverty, family background and the gaps between the rich and the rest.

headline.main: Harder for Americans to Rise From Lower Rungs
headline.print_headline: Harder for Americans to Rise From Economy’s Lower Rungs
